name: STOMACH
V: Decreased secretions, irregular appetite, frequent eructation (belching, hiccup), sense of constriction
P: Excessive appetite, sour or pungent eructation, burning sensation, ulcers, cancer
K: Slow digestion, sweet or mucoid eructation
desc: Heartburn, hyperacidity or burning stomach pain relates primarily to Pitta. Nausea, feeling of heaviness and vomiting are characteristic of Kapha, or eating too much Kapha food. Vata causes irregular peristalsis, and dryness in the stomach.
